result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Philander P Reed not in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Philander P Reed.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. DE did not appear for jury selection as scheduled. Atty Campbell advises that Mr. Reed was given the information for today's court appearance. DE appeared at 8:45 am for jury selection. Bailiff sent down to retrieve jurors at 8:46 am. Prospective jurors brought in at 9:18 am. Prospective jurors sworn in at 9:21 am. Court with voir dire. State with voir dire. Atty Campbell-Hunter with voir dire. Parties select their strikes. Jury is selected. Jury sworn in at 10:37 am. Jury excused at 10:38 am. Parties discuss motions in limine filed by the State. All of the State's motion in limine are granted.

Parties have not reached an agreement on this case. Court will set this case for trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 10:45 am.
Jury selection scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on February 7, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on January 30, 2023 at 10:45 am.

3:55 PM . Defendant Philander P Reed in court..  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Philander P Reed.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

2:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Philander P Reed in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Philander P Reed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Asha G except only for the purposes of arranging child exchange or placement. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Asha G or any member of her immediate family
- Defendant shall not be in the 1515 block of Park Cir in Sun Prairie, except for purposes of arranging child exchange or placement.
-Defendant may retrieve belongings from 1515 block of Park Cir if accompanied by law enforcement 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Philander P Reed in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Philander P Reed. Arguments for modification of bail made by defense. Court agrees to amend bond.
filed by Atty Campbell Hunter

Court reporter Teri Groves.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court on behalf of defendant.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE did not appear or contact the court. Atty Campbell-Hunter was not able to contact her client today. State requests a cash bench warrant for $250.00. Atty Campbell-Hunter responds. Court will decline to issue a warrant. Bond motion is denied.

02:18 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
